q: of doing so, but it turns out a State Department cable exists in which Saddam Hussein thanked Donald Rumsfeld for the message. The letter must have come from the State Department itself, Donald Rumsfeld says. How could anyone believe that you couldn't remember if you delivered a letter from Ronald Reagan to Saddam Hussein ? he says. "That's the kind of thing that persuaded me to take my time and look at the documents, since I had so many of them." Amber Van Brunt( PICTURE): Nurse

it. During a recent stroll through the National Museum of George Washington History, Sen. Bernie Sanders discovered that a number of products sold in the gift shop were not made America, but produced in other countries. I find it especially disappointing that miniature sculptures of presidents George Washington that are sold in the museum, including George Washington , Thomas Jefferson , and Barack Obama were made in China, Sen. Bernie Sanders wrote in a letter to the museum director. http://sanders.senate.gov/statues.html Miniature sculptures on sale at the National Museum of George Washington History Sen. Notably, Roy Greenslade pointed out that News Corp's The Times carried two-and-a-half pages inside plus a leader, which argued that ever since Andy Coulson 's appointment there was always a risk that this story( about phone-hacking) would return . By contrast, the Daily Telegraph, the Daily Mail and the Sun gave little space to the story. The Sunday Express carried a "short anodyne piece on page 10," Roy Greenslade said
